subclusters.subcluster_name: Klotho-FGF23 Phosphate Metabolism and Mineral Homeostasis Theory
Klotho Wnt Signaling Antagonism and Stem Cell Preservation Theory

theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on Klotho as an aging suppressor via inhibition of insulin/IGF-1 signaling and modulation of intracellular pathways including oxidative stress resistance.
Emphasizes Klotho’s inhibition of insulin/IGF-1 signaling leading to FoxO activation and mitochondrial antioxidant enzyme upregulation.
Describes secreted Klotho’s endocrine role inhibiting insulin/IGF-1 signaling and regulating phosphate metabolism linked to aging.
Details Klotho’s suppression of insulin/IGF-1 and Wnt signaling pathways, oxidative stress inhibition, and lifespan extension.
Focuses on secreted Klotho inhibiting insulin/IGF-1 signaling via receptor glycan modification, linking genetic variants to healthy aging.
Highlights Klotho as a circulating hormone suppressing insulin/IGF-1 signaling to extend lifespan.
Describes Klotho’s role in oxidative stress suppression via FOXO activation and insulin/IGF-1 signaling inhibition.
Details Klotho’s repression of insulin and IGF1 receptor signaling as a conserved mechanism for lifespan extension.
Describes alpha-Klotho’s inhibition of insulin/IGF-1 signaling, FOXO activation, and antioxidant enzyme upregulation.
Pleiotropic anti-aging effects of secreted Klotho include modulation of insulin/IGF-1 and Wnt pathways, reducing inflammation and oxidative stress.
Focuses on pleiotropic anti-aging roles of Klotho isoforms including epigenetic regulation and inflammation reduction linked to insulin/IGF-1 signaling.
Klotho’s neuroprotective effects via oxidative stress reduction and modulation of insulin/IGF-1 signaling and inflammation.
Klotho upregulation by aerobic exercise reduces ROS and extends lifespan, linked to insulin/IGF-1 signaling modulation.
Klotho gene regulates oxidative stress and signaling pathways including insulin/IGF-1, exerting cytoprotective anti-aging effects.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Klotho-FGF23 Phosphate Metabolism and Mineral Homeostasis Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on Klotho as co-receptor for FGF23 regulating phosphate excretion and vitamin D metabolism linked to aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Klotho-FGF23 Phosphate Metabolism and Mineral Homeostasis Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes Klotho’s regulation of mineral metabolism via FGF23 co-receptor function affecting phosphate and vitamin D homeostasis.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Klotho-FGF23 Phosphate Metabolism and Mineral Homeostasis Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details aKlotho/FGF23 hormonal axis regulating phosphate metabolism and vascular calcification linked to aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Klotho-FGF23 Phosphate Metabolism and Mineral Homeostasis Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Klotho deficiency causes dysregulated vitamin D and calcium metabolism leading to tissue damage and aging phenotypes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Klotho-FGF23 Phosphate Metabolism and Mineral Homeostasis Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Klotho deficiency causes hyperphosphatemia and vascular calcification, linking phosphate imbalance to systemic aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Klotho-FGF23 Phosphate Metabolism and Mineral Homeostasis Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Klotho’s role as cofactor for FGF23 and regulator of mineral metabolism influences aging and age-related disorders.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Klotho Mitochondrial Dysfunction and Muscle Regeneration Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on age-related α-Klotho decline causing mitochondrial dysfunction in muscle progenitor cells impairing regeneration.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Klotho Wnt Signaling Antagonism and Stem Cell Preservation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Klotho antagonizes Wnt signaling to preserve stem cell function and prevent progenitor senescence driving aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Klotho Wnt Signaling Antagonism and Stem Cell Preservation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Klotho deficiency activates Wnt signaling causing stem cell senescence and tissue atrophy; Klotho suppresses Wnt to protect stem cells.
